title: Ticket #4155: Improve handling of coresize for jobs
description: In the kernel interface for setting limits on core file size (setrlimit()), the special value RLIM_INFINITY means unlimited. It's always unsigned, but its value and type size vary between platforms. It's not always -1 cast to an unsigned type. Also, now that ClassAds support 64-bit integers, we should recognize large coresize values.
